modules.description: Processes iCalendar data by parsing and constructing components like events and alarms, with support for handling raw string values and parameterized properties. Operates on structured elements containing keys, values, and associated parameters, all rooted in raw string representations. Used to generate and interpret iCalendar files by manipulating element lists and parameterized data.

Processes a string input to generate a list of line records, each containing parsed lexical elements. It works with string inputs and produces structured line data with tokenized content. Used to transform raw text into a format suitable for further analysis or processing in language tools.

Validates date-time values, converts them to strings, and parses strings into date-time objects using a specified location. It handles time zones and supports parsing ICal data with distinct datetime and raw string representations. Used for ensuring correct date-time formatting and processing calendar events.

Validates date structures, converts them to string representations, and parses strings into date values based on specified locations. Works with a structured date type containing year, month, and day components. Used to ensure input date formats are correct and to standardize date display across different locales.

Processes iCalendar data by parsing and generating components like events and alarms, handling structured elements with nested parameters and raw string values. Operates on lists of elements containing keys, values, and associated parameters, supporting precise manipulation of calendar entries. Used to extract or construct calendar data from raw strings, enabling accurate data transformation and validation.

Processes a string input to generate a list of line records, each containing parsed lexical elements. It works with string inputs and produces structured line data including tokens and positions. Used to analyze source code for tokenization and syntax highlighting.

Validates a date-time structure, converts it to a string representation, and parses strings into the structure using a specified location. It handles time zones and works with a custom date-time type that includes timezone information. Parses ICal-formatted datetime values, distinguishing between parsed and raw string representations.

Validates date integrity, converts dates to string representations, and parses strings into date objects based on a specified location. Works with a structured date type containing year, month, and day fields. Used to ensure input date strings are correctly formatted and to standardize date handling across region-specific formats.

Processes iCalendar data by parsing and constructing components such as events and alarms, handling raw strings and parameterized properties. Transforms raw text into structured line records with tokenized content for further processing. Validates and converts date-time and date values, ensuring proper formatting and timezone handling for calendar-related operations. Enables generation of iCalendar files, analysis of textual input, and accurate date/time manipulation across different locales.

Processes iCalendar data by parsing and constructing components like events and alarms, with support for custom properties and parameters. Operates on structured data including raw strings, key-value pairs, and element lists representing calendar entries. Used to generate and manipulate calendar objects for scheduling and data exchange.

Processes a string input to generate a list of line records, each containing tokenized lexical elements and their positions. Works with string inputs and produces structured line data including tokens, start indices, and end indices. Used to analyze source code for syntax highlighting or preprocessing tasks.

Validates date-time values, converts them to strings, and parses strings into date-time objects using a specified location. It handles time zones and supports parsing Ical data structures that may contain either parsed date-times or raw strings. Used for ensuring correct date-time formatting and processing calendar data from external sources.

Validates date structures, converts them to formatted strings, and parses strings into date values based on specified locations. Works with a structured date type containing year, month, and day components. Used to ensure input date strings are correctly formatted and to standardize date representations across system components.

This module provides core set operations like union, intersection, and difference, along with membership checks and cardinality queries, operating on generic set types with elements of type `elt`. It supports functional transformations, iteration, and sequence-based conversions, enabling tasks such as dynamic data manipulation and string collection processing. Specific use cases include filtering large datasets, constructing sets from iterative sources, and performing efficient element-wise computations.

Provides functions to parse and generate ICAL (iCalendar) format, including handling events, alarms, and time zones. Operates on structured data types such as date-time values, recurrence rules, and calendar components. Used to convert between human-readable calendar data and machine-parsable ICAL strings in applications like scheduling tools and calendar sync services.

Processes iCalendar data by parsing and generating components such as events and alarms, handling nested parameters and raw values, while also tokenizing string inputs into structured line records. It includes date and datetime validation, conversion, and parsing, supporting timezone-aware date-time structures and region-specific date formats. These capabilities enable precise manipulation of calendar entries, source code analysis, and reliable date handling. Examples include extracting event details from iCal strings, tokenizing calendar data for processing, and validating date inputs for correct formatting.

Combines iCalendar parsing, validation, and manipulation with set operations and lexical analysis. Handles structured date-time and date values, generates and processes calendar components, and supports set-based data transformations. Processes raw strings into tokenized line records and ensures proper formatting across time zones. Enables tasks like scheduling, data normalization, and efficient set-based computations.
